message_catalog.msg: Value is out of range or blank.
Answers question: Might this path be significant in context of a Critical Path?
The number of times a base activity is processed, when an activity is defined as a multiple of another.
Number of times an activity is completed across all paths.
Cost of an activity at predesignated Cost Probability Point
A sequential activity number for waypoint or activity. Each path's first activity begins with one.
Eco2 of an activity at predesignated Cost Probability Point
A unique reference or ID for a specific, possibly repeatable task.
The minimum sequence number of an activity in a path.
The name of the table containing the Task Network to use for a scenario.
The Table ID referencing the Task Network to use for a scenario.
The duration of an activity at predesignated Time Probability Point
Reference for an activity defined in the scenario's referenced Task Types (p3) table.
No cost curve aid_type found while loading activity_table.
No eco2 curve aid_type found while loading activity_table.
No time curve aid_type found while loading activity_table.
Source of cost distribution curve (via acc_fin::curve_import)
The actual cost it took to complete an activity.
A cost distribution curve referenced by Name.
A cost distribution curve referenced by Table ID
The estimated highest cost of an activity or task type.
The estimated median cost of an activity or task type.
The estimated lowest cost of an activity or task type.
A percentage along one or more (cumulative) distribution curves representing a range of costs.
Answers question: How many of this activity is on the critical path?
Answers question about an activity. 1 is yes, 0 is no.
A number specifying the count of digits to the right of the decimal for cost units.
A format to use for a report.
All dependencies could not be met. Possible circular reference in dependencies.
Answers question about an activity. 1 is yes, 0 is no.
Circular reference. Activity includes a dependent with same reference as itself.
Tasks that this activity or task directly depends on.
Types that this Task Type depends on.
A sentence or phrase describing activity or task type.
Tasks that an activity directly depends on.
A table representing a discrete distribution curve.
Source of eco2 distribution curve (via acc_fin::curve_import)
The eco2 it took to complete an activity.
An eco2 distribution curve referenced by Name.
An eco2 distribution curve referenced by Table ID
The estimated highest eco2 of an activity or task type.
The estimated median eco2 of an activity or task type.
The estimated lowest eco2 of an activity or task type.
A percentage along one or more (cumulative) distribution curves representing a range of eco2 values.
A number specifying the count of digits to the right of the decimal for eco2 units.
y in a dc table cannot be 0 when calculating task_run_time with a coefficient and a dominant max_run_time constraint.
DC value y is greater than max_run_time. max_run_time ignored.
Index value using a custom (non-PRETTI) index equation
A user defined function for purposes of prioritizing paths differently than PRETTI.
Variables used in creating a custom PRETTI index for path sorting.
An internal error occured while attempting to create a table.
A tag reference or short phrase that identifies a data point.
Leave blank to use the system default.
The maximum number of a specific activity that can operate indefinitely.
Maximum Discount for batch (contiguous) runs. Expressed as a percent cost of a run. A 10% discount equals '0.1'.
A decimal percentage (0 to 1) of maximum amount of overlap between concurrent operations of same activity.
Maximum duration of paths that have a specific activity in common.
Maximum Reduction for batch (contiguous) runs. Expressed as a percent eco2 of a run. A 10% reduction equals '0.1'.
A constraint of a maximum time a batch can run before a break.
A constraint of a maximum number of times a task can be repeated without a break.
A unique word used as a reference as in a variable or table name.
Answers question: Is this activity on a significant path?
Cost of a completed path including all dependencies not on path.
A path sequence number for this report.
One route along the network from begining to end.
Eco2 of a completed path including all dependencies not on path.
An internally fixed path reference number for this report.
Calculate a value from PERT 'expected time function' where Te = ( Optimal + 4 x Median + Pessimistic ) / 6
Number of Points should be greater than five or blank.
An indication to the relative use of item compared to others.
A number specifying the count of digits to the right of the decimal.
A tabular report with one path per column.
A tabular report with one activity per row.
A tabular report with one path per row.
A table of named variables and their values (name, value pairs) that specify a scenario. Rows and columns may be in any order.
Set max_run_time longer or blank (no limit).
Answers question about a path of activities. 1 is yes, 0 is no.
Source of time distribution curve (via acc_fin::curve_import)
There was an error while loading table.
A table defining tasks and their dependencies. Columns may be in any order.
A Task Types (p3) Table referenced by Name
A table defining task types. Columns may be in any order.
A Task Types (p3) Table referenced by Table ID
task_types_tid is required in table p1 when table p2 has a nonempty aid_type column.
The actual time it took for an activity to complete.
A time distribution curve referenced by Name
A time distribution curve referenced by Table ID
The estimated longest duration of an activity or task type.
The estimated median duration of an activity or task type.
The estimated shortest duration of an activity or task type.
A percentage along one or more (cumulative) distribution curves representing a range of durations.
A number specifying the count of digits to the right of the decimal for time units.
A classification of an activity or task.
There are unacceptable values in this set.
Specifies a column containing variable values.
Specifies a column containing variable values.
Subtotal of an activity's cost and it's dependencies at specified Cost Probability Point
Duration of a path of activities and it's dependencies at specified Time Probability Point.
Subtotal of an activity's eco2 and it's dependencies at specified Eco2 Probability Point
A number representing a relative weighted value or decimal probability percent (0 to 1) of variable Y occurring within a discrete (possibly cumulative) distribution.
A value of time, cost, eco2 or other measure in a discrete set of variable Y values, where each value is associated with a probability or relative weighted frequency.
